Description: Terracotta figure of Osiris-Canopus, incorporating a small lamp in the plinth. The head wears a 'nemes' headdress, with uraeus on the brow, surmounted by the horns, leaves and disc of the atef crown. A rectangular bulla hangs on the chest by a cord round the shoulders; below the cord are two large circular impressions. The back has no detail, and a circular depression is situated in its centre. Brown, micaceous clay; details of face, headdress and the bulla cord picked out in black; traces of white on headdress, crown and bulla; these pigmentation details are probably of post-firing application.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV First century BC/AD. Comparanda: Very close: Dunand 1979: 273 and 364 = LIMC vii (2): pl. 86, Osiris-Kanopos 42a. Near: Fischer 1994: no. 790, dated second quarter of third century AD; Kaufmann 1913: fig. 59:4. A better-modelled and more ornate example was once in the Loukas Benaki Collection (photograph in G&R Departmental files). Bibliog. Budge 1925: pl. xxviii; Bailey 1988: Q 1979; Fischer 1994: 324, no. 790.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (1979)
Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3024)
